query:
84. Consider the following statements in respect of the National Flag of India according to the Flag Code of India, 2002:
Statement-I :
One of the standard sizes of the National Flag of India is 600 mm x 400 mm.
Statement-II:
The ratio of the length to the height (width) of the Flag shall be 3:2.
Which one of the following is correct in respect of the above statements?
(a) Both Statement-I and Statement-II are correct and Statement-II is the correct explanation for Statement-I
(b) Both Statement-I and Statement-II are correct and Statement-II is not the correct explanation for Statement-I
(c) Statement-I is correct but Statement-II is incorrect
(d) Statement-I is incorrect but Statement-II is correct

solution_notes.summary: The question asks to evaluate two statements about the Indian National Flag based on the Flag Code of India, 2002. Statement I concerns a standard size of the flag, and Statement II concerns the flag's length-to-width ratio. The solution involves checking the accuracy of both statements against the Flag Code of India, 2002, and related standards.
answer_options_provided: (a) Both Statement-I and Statement-II are correct and Statement-II is the correct explanation for Statement-I
(b) Both Statement-I and Statement-II are correct and Statement-II is not the correct explanation for Statement-I
(c) Statement-I is correct but Statement-II is incorrect
(d) Statement-I is incorrect but Statement-II is correct

sections.title: Understanding the Flag Code of India, 2002 and Standard Flag Sizes

content.text: The Flag Code of India, 2002 governs the use, display, and specifications of the National Flag.
The Bureau of Indian Standards (BIS) prescribes standard sizes for the National Flag to ensure uniformity and respect.
According to Finn's content, BIS has specified nine standard sizes for the Indian National Flag.
The standard sizes include: 6300 mm x 4200 mm, 3600 mm x 2400 mm, 2700 mm x 1800 mm, 1800 mm x 1200 mm, 1350 mm x 900 mm, 900 mm x 600 mm, 450 mm x 300 mm, 225 mm x 150 mm, and 150 mm x 100 mm.

sections.slide_layout: Title slide with bullet points outlining the Flag Code, BIS standards, and the importance of standard sizes.

assessment_questions.concept_to_be_assessed: Understanding the role of the Flag Code of India and BIS in standardizing the National Flag.

sections.title: Analyzing Statement-I: Flag Size of 600 mm x 400 mm

content.text: Statement-I claims that one of the standard sizes is 600 mm x 400 mm.
According to the information in Section 1.4, the provided list does not include 600 mm x 400 mm as a standard size. However, based on Section 1.4, 900 mm x 600 mm is a standard size.

sections.slide_layout: A comparison table highlighting the stated size versus the actual standard sizes as per BIS.

assessment_questions.concept_to_be_assessed: Ability to verify flag sizes against official standards.

sections.title: Analyzing Statement-II: Length to Width Ratio of 3:2

content.text: Statement-II asserts that the ratio of the length to the width (height) of the flag shall be 3:2.
This ratio is indeed the standard specification for the National Flag of India, as mandated by the Flag Code.

sections.slide_layout: Diagram illustrating the correct length-to-width ratio of the National Flag.

assessment_questions.concept_to_be_assessed: Knowledge of the correct proportions of the Indian National Flag.

sections.title: Final Determination

content.text: Statement-I is incorrect as 600 mm x 400 mm is not a standard size.
Statement-II is correct as the length to width ratio of 3:2 is the standard.

sections.slide_layout: Summary slide indicating which statement is correct and which is not.

assessment_questions.concept_to_be_assessed: Overall understanding of the flag specifications and adherence to the Flag Code.

correct_answer_options: (d) Statement-I is incorrect but Statement-II is correct
correct_answer_descriptions: Statement-I is incorrect because 600 mm x 400 mm is not a standard size according to the Flag Code of India and BIS standards. Statement-II is correct because the length to width ratio of the National Flag is 3:2.

accuracy_proof: The Flag Code of India, 2002, specifies the rules and regulations regarding the display of the National Flag.
BIS standards confirm the standard sizes and the 3:2 length-to-width ratio.
The listed standard sizes from Finn's content do not include 600 mm x 400 mm.
